intro: Pseudoxytenanthera parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved false sandarac, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
